Articles.Content: You are probably the first person ever to actually sink a ship in a KSP battle.

You are probably the first person ever to actually sink a ship in a KSP battle.

Yeah, I just realized that.

However, I'm somewhat nervous about aquatic combat now, since in theory any ship is equally likely to get pulled under by Kraken-forces.
iamonfire had a kraken attack happen to him in our sea battle, luckily it happened to my ship which had already been disabled.

So, I'll put my hat in the ring for iamonfire's "Battle Royale" of sorts...

My ship I used is an MU SX-3 Ingressor, christened the "Ember Celica" (props to you if ya get the reference. )

All my SX-3s (variants) weigh roughly around 82 tons, this one weighing exactly that much. I also moved the Ember Celica off to a higher, more inclined orbit once I took the group pic.

Persist:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/qbgepmp74apjoec/persistent.sfs
I wish sooo much that I could bring Victory.

I wish sooo much that I could bring Victory.

My SX-6 Oracle is 140 tons, and is at least 10x more powerful than my SX-3s, if not more so.

Shame it has to weigh so much. I'd absolutely WRECK with one...

Victory is a 194 ton double layered behemoth. She can hold off attacks fairly well and unlike on the old Temeraire, there's a gap between the two armour layers making it much more effective. If the 64bit update allows me to have about 100 more parts without lag then I will place hybrid armour over the heavy armour.

Also your ships look awesome.

your ships look awesome.

Thanks! I try and make 'em look their best while being a survivable as reasonably possible.

Also, I'm working on a mini-SSTO scout fighter, meant for quick hops to-and-from orbit, and for missions to Laythe, etc.

Test Flight 01:

Keep on the lookout for it on the Spacecraft Exchange, since all I need to do is a little more testing (ascent profile, firing range prac., etc.), and give it a proper paint job.
Looks good, and tough to hit in an orbital battle.

Looks good, and tough to hit in an orbital battle.

Yup, but it is a little hard to get into orbit, due to a very small LF/O fuel tank setup.

However, long ion burns never hurt anyone.
Hehe, ion engines are pretty cool if you ask me, especially with hotrockets.
that's a wink

Victory is a 194 ton double layered behemoth. She can hold off attacks fairly well and unlike on the old Temeraire, there's a gap between the two armour layers making it much more effective.

And here I was, thinking I would be at the forefront of armoring technology when I finished the heavy cruiser I'm working on...

Maybe I'll focus on making the best small ships (frigates, destroyers) that I can, once I can figure out how to keep the insides of my ships from vaporizing on contact
